Class DrawingBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • DrawingBoard

  • public class DrawingBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class keeps track of a list of Shapes user passed in. It also keeps track of a selected shape, which will always be on top of the other shapes,
    Version:
    01/19/12
    Author:
    Chun-Wei Chen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DrawingBoard()
      Constucts a DrawingBoard and initializes the shapeList.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Shape s)
      Adds Shape to the DrawingBoard and makes this Shape becomes the selected shape.
      void findShapeContainsPoint(int x, int y)
      Finds the topmost Shape that contains the point (x, y) and makes that Shape become the selected shape.
      Shape getSelectedShape()
      Returns the selected shape.
      java.util.ArrayList<Shape> getShapeList()
      Returns a copy of the ArrayList of Shapes in the DrawingBoard.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Tests if constructur and methods work fine.
      void moveSelectedShape(int changeInX, int changeInY)
      Moves the selected shape by a specified amount.
      void removeSelectedShape()
      Removes the selected shape.
      void setSelectedShapeColor(java.awt.Color c)
      Sets the Color of the selected shape.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawingBoard

        public DrawingBoard()
        Constucts a DrawingBoard and initializes the shapeList.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Shape s)
        Adds Shape to the DrawingBoard and makes this Shape becomes the selected shape.
        Parameters:
        s - a Shape
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s is null

      • findShapeContainsPoint

        public void findShapeContainsPoint(int x,
                          int y)
        Finds the topmost Shape that contains the point (x, y) and makes that Shape become the selected shape. If no Shape contains the point (x,y), then no Shape is the selected shape.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the point
        y - y-coordinate of the point

      • getSelectedShape

        public Shape getSelectedShape()
        Returns the selected shape. If no Shape is currently selected, return null.
        Returns:
        the selected shape; null if no Shape is currently selected

      • removeSelectedShape

        public void removeSelectedShape()
        Removes the selected shape.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Shape is currently selected

      • setSelectedShapeColor

        public void setSelectedShapeColor(java.awt.Color c)
        Sets the Color of the selected shape.
        Parameters:
        c - the new Color for the selected shape
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if c is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Shape is currently selected

      • moveSelectedShape

        public void moveSelectedShape(int changeInX,
                     int changeInY)
        Moves the selected shape by a specified amount.
        Parameters:
        changeInX - the difference between the initial x-coordinate and new x-coordinate
        changeInY - the difference between the initial y-coordinate and new y-coordinate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Shape is currently selected

      • getShapeList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Shape> getShapeList()
        Returns a copy of the ArrayList of Shapes in the DrawingBoard.
        Returns:
        a copy of the ArrayList of Shapes in the DrawingBoard

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Tests if constructur and methods work fine.
        Parameters:
        args -
